channel.name: How to verify an array of Proof from one ZkProgram within another ZkProgram?

messages.content:
For example as below, zkProgram2 need verify serveral zkProgram1's proof in batch.  But `Proof `is not a type of CircuitValue, so if I define directly an Array for `Proof` as zkProgram2's `privateInputs` as blow,  error occurs.   
Any solutions for this??  @gregor

ooh, i'm working on the same problem - i'll just copy and paste what i wrote before here:

```typescript
class SProof extends Experimental.ZkProgram.Proof(S) {...}
  const leaves = Provable.Array(Experimental.ZkProgram.Proof(SProof), 5)
```
I'm attempting to use `leaves` as a privateInput, but types are not playing nice. 

ok...
this typechecks, but I lose type information:
```ts
  const leaves = provablePure(Array(numOfAccounts).fill(Experimental.ZkProgram.Proof(SProof)))
```

Yeah I think the problem is that we're special casing things instead of having Proof be a normal 'Provable'. In some places that's necessary.. (see proof_system.ts in snarkyjs if you're interested)

I think the proper way would be to make proofs a Provable and find a way to pull out the proofs from privateInputs even if they are nested arbitrarily deep in other Provables
hi, @arj  I tried as you, but meet errors during circuit compilation
I was getting a thread issue, maybe same
My intuition was both provers ended up in the same context, but they need to be isolated
just a guess
hi, @gregor  I tried make proofs a Provable and typechecks successfully, however meet errors during circuit compilation.  do you have any solution samples for me , appreciate!
could you pls show your code case to take a look?

error msg:
```
/Users/arj/arj/pacioli/node_modules/.pnpm/snarkyjs@0.11.0/node_modules/snarkyjs/dist/node/lib/global-context.js:62
  if (current.id !== id) throw Error(contextConflictMessage);
                               ^

Error: It seems you're running multiple provers concurrently within the same JavaScript thread, which, at the moment, is not supported and would lead to bugs.
    at leave (/Users/arj/arj/pacioli/node_modules/.pnpm/snarkyjs@0.11.0/node_modules/snarkyjs/src/lib/global-context.ts:94:24)
    at Function.leave (/Users/arj/arj/pacioli/node_modules/.pnpm/snarkyjs@0.11.0/node_modules/snarkyjs/src/lib/global-context.ts:71:15)
    at Object.prove_ [as init] (/Users/arj/arj/pacioli/node_modules/.pnpm/snarkyjs@0.11.0/node_modules/snarkyjs/src/lib/proof_system.ts:293:22)
    at /Users/arj/arj/pacioli/libs/zkLedger/test/VectorTAccount.test.ts:56:14
    at async Promise.all (index 0)

```

```ts
    console.log('compiling Vector verificationKey...')
    let result = await VectorTAccount.compile();
    vectorVerificationKey = result.verificationKey;

    console.log('compiling Scalar verificationKey...')
    result = await ScalarTAccount.compile()
    scalarVerificationKey = result.verificationKey
```
this compiles, but fails when proving scalar.init()
sry, it's kinda messy
check if you awaited all promises regarding compile/prove/transaction
i also saw this error when i imported multiple versions of snarkyjs, so make sure your project uses just one snarkyjs and all libraries you create/use have snarkyjs as a peer dependency
within  `VectorTAccount.init() `,   could u pls add `proof.verify()` and take a new compile?

```
TypeError: nScalarTAcc.verify is not a function

      40 |
      41 |           leaves.map(nScalarTAcc => {
> 42 |             nScalarTAcc.verify()
         |                         ^
      43 |             map.set(nScalarTAcc.publicInput.name, nScalarTAcc.publicInput.taccount_hash)
      44 |           })
      45 |
```
ok, this didn't happen before - let me figure it out

There is no solution along that lines because if the proofs are wrapped up in a Provable, then our code no longer processes them correctly. Passing each proof as a separate input is really the only way I think we support right now
@arj even if you should get your stuff to compile/run, snarkyjs won't verify the proofs in that array
yes, indeed, my existing solution is by Passing each proof as a separate input. But it would be verbose  if there are  many proofs as input
I'll write up an issue to address this. Filed under "recursion / offchain usability improvements"
appreciate!
@coldStar1993 @arj also note that Pickles only supports recursively verifying 0, 1 or 2 proofs, not more
So it may not be that verbose to list them 😄
btw, will this number increase in the future?
It's not planned since it comes at a cost for the verifying Mina node to support more proofs, and since you can merge any number in a binary tree
